author: tbenr
content:
Thanks for the info. Seems like `FIAT_SHAMIR_PROTOCOL_DOMAIN`  is more a constant than a preset.
Just for additional clarification: everything under `polynomial-commitments.md` falls under the responsibility of the kzg library (ie validation that BLSFieldElements  must be in `0 <= x < BLS_MODULUS` ), is that correct?

author: kevaundray
content:
Yeah that’s a protocol constant, that would not change.

Yeah, that’s the idea, for that particular check, there is an issue here for it: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/3057

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> > <dankrad>  7 is the right one. 5 is not primitive (re @sharded_data_bot: <Kev> [reply]: Libraries will usually define a primitive root, usually it’s the smallest one and this is used to generate the roots of unity for size 4096. The primitive root for the field being used should be 5, I believe the specs used 7 which may need to be changed)

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  Yep, made a typo, thanks for the correction (re @dankrad: 7 is the right one. 5 is not primitive)
